question.questionA: Evergreen  shrubs or small trees; leaves up to 3 cm broad, ovate, alternate; fruit a warty globose berry.
question.questionB: Evergreen shrubs; leaves 1-2 mm broad, needle-like, in whorls; fruit a loculicidal capsule.

question.questionA: Shrubs  flowering  from  February to May; flowers white, axillary, forming long pyramidal panicles; stamens included in the corolla..
question.questionB: Shrubs  flowering mainly from August to September; flowers pink, axillary, forming compact pyramidal  clusters; stamens exerted from the corolla.
